channel.title: Juneberries on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Juneberries on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: Juneberries are ripe
item.description: Juneberries are ripe in Ann Arbor on June 15 - I was able to harvest a few of them on North Campus by the Duderstadt building and on Central Campus by the detours around the Engineering Arch. Get them before the birds do!

item.title: Expect the 2013 crop of juneberries to be a good one in Ann Arbor
item.description:
That's the word from Ann Arbor Chronicle contributor Linda Diane Feldt:

Service berries (aka June berries) appear to be on schedule. They taste like blueberries. Very edible. They will be ripe in two to three weeks [from May 23, 2013]. 

That puts a projected juneberry first picking date at about June 7, after the peonies start but before the u-pick strawberries are ready.

More details on the Arborwiki Juneberries page.
